body.p: A WebHelp publishing template consist of a set of resources(CSS, JS, fonts) used to define the ouput. These resources and other information are referenced from a descriptor file. All these resources that defines the template can be stored in a ZIP archive or they can be stored in a folder.

dlentry.dd: The template descriptor is an XML file that defines all the resources included by a template like HTML page templates, CSS, JS, fonts, transformation parameters.

The HTML pages that comprise the output of a WebHelp Responsive system are obtained after processing HTML template pages. An HTML page template is a HTML file that include one or more WebHelp template components like: publication title, breadcrumb and others.

The WebHelp Publishing Template allows you to specify one or more XSLT extension points. They are helpful when you want to change the structure of the HTML pages that are mainly generated from XSLT processing.
The HTML page templates have defined some injection points that can be used to insert additional content in the generated HTML pages.
You can define one or more transformation parameters in a template.
